Really? Bukannya fast fashion brands kayak Zara, H&M, Cotton On, Pull & Bear, Stradivarius yang jauh lebih bikin bisnis lokal terpuruk ya? As a (small) shoe entrepreneur, ya kali bisa compete sama sneakers di H&M yang cuma Rp 199.000, sedangkan biaya produksi di Indonesia aja gak bisa segitu. When we say textile industry, can we also consider the environmental impact of continuing to produce new fabrics all the time? Can we think on a bigger scale, how to move forward more sustainably? I don't have an exact solution (duh!), but I think it's worth rethinking the whole landscape instead langsung bikin keputusan seperti ini. Just a while ago, kemenparekraf bangga banget Billie Eilish pake karya anak Indo. Tapi itu kan karya upcycling, which utilizes secondhand garments. I dream of the Indonesian goverment lebih forward thinking about the fashion industry. Fokus more into combatting barang KW, edukasi soal plagiarisme, push designers to innovate dan bukan jadi trend follower, ngajak entrepreneurs utk mengedepankan environmental values. Indonesia banyak orang kreatif tapi gak banyak yang visioner. Focus on the essentials? ✨
